# Add the cauliflower to a food processor and process until chunky rice forms.
# Remove from the food processor, add the garlic, cilantro, and parsley into the food processor and blend until finely chopped.
# Mix in the cauliflower back along with almond flour, egg, and spices and process until well combined.
# Shape the mixture into bite sizes balls and place the falafel balls onto the prepared baking sheet.
# Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden for about 35-40 minutes, enjoy with a dipping sauce of your choice.

morning_snack.title: Authentic guacamole
morning_snack.ingredients:
# onion
# serrano peppers
# fresh cilantro leaves
# avocado
# lime juice
morning_snack.cooking:
# Mash the onion, chile, and half of the cilantro to a paste in a molcajete or other small bowl. Add salt to taste.
# You can also mince and mash the ingredients together on a cutting board with a large knife or a fork, and then transfer the paste to a bowl.
# Score the flesh in the avocado half in a crosshatch pattern (not through the skin) with a knife and then scoop it with a spoon into the molcajete or bowl.
# Toss well, then add the rest of the cilantro and lime juice, and mash coarsely with a pestle or a fork.

dinner.title: Chicken and wild rice
dinner.ingredients:
# chicken strips
# canned cooked lentils
# wild rice
# water
# cauliflower
dinner.cooking:
# Place the wild rice in a fine-mesh strainer and rinse in the sink under cold running water. Shake to drain. Place the rice in a saucepan and add 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. When the water has reached a boil, lower the heat to maintain a slow but steady simmer and cover the pan. Cook at a simmer for 45 minutes. Check the rice. It should be chewy and some of the grains will have burst open. It may need an additional 10 to 15 minutes - keep checking the rice and stop cooking the grains are tender.
# When the rice is done, pour it into a strainer to drain off any remaining liquid.
# Chop cauliflower into bite size pieces, boil for 10-20 minutes, or until preferred softness. Bake  chicken stripea according to instruction on the packaging.
# Plate wild rice, chicken stripes, cooked lentil, cauliflower and enjoy.

data.title: 60 Days Mediterranean Meal Plan for omnivores

breakfast.title: Mexican beans & avocado on toast
breakfast.ingredients:
# cherry tomatoes, quartered
# red or white onion, finely chopped
# lime, juiced
# xolive oil
# garlic cloves, crushed
# ground cumin
# chipotle paste or 1 tsp chilli flakes
# black beans, drained
# coriander, chopped
# slices bread
# avocado, finely sliced
breakfast.cooking:
# Mix the tomatoes, ¼ onion, lime juice and 1 tbsp oil and set aside. Fry the remaining onion in 2 tbsp oil until it starts to soften. Add the garlic, fry for 1 min, then add the cumin and chipotle and stir until fragrant. Tip in the beans and a splash of water, stir and cook gently until heated through. Stir in most of the tomato mixture and cook for 1 min, season well and add most of the coriander.
# Toast the bread and drizzle with the remaining 1 tbsp oil. Put a slice on each plate and pile some beans on top. Arrange some slices of avocado on top, then sprinkle with the remaining tomato mixture and coriander leaves to serve.
breakfast.portions:
# 270g 
# 1 
# ½ 
# 4 tbsp 
# 2 
# 1 tsp
# 2 tsp 
# 2 x 400g cans 
# small bunch 
# 4 .
# 1

lunch.title: Honey & mustard chicken thighs with spring veg
lunch.ingredients:
# honey
# wholegrain mustard
# garlic cloves, crushed
# zest and juice lemon
# chicken thighs, skin on
# new potatoes, unpeeled, smaller left whole, bigger halved
# olive oil
# spinach
# frozen peas
lunch.cooking:
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a small bowl, mix together the honey, mustard, garlic and the lemon zest and juice. Pour the marinade over the chicken thighs and season.
# Put the chicken, skin-side up, on a large baking tray, and then dot the new potatoes in between them. Drizzle the oil over the potatoes and sprinkle with sea salt. Roast in the oven for 35 mins until the chicken skin caramelizes and is charred in places.
# Add the spinach and peas to the roasting tray. Return to the oven for 2-3 mins until the spinach has begun to wilt and the peas are hot and covered in the mustardy sauce.

dinner.title: Broccoli pesto & pancetta pasta
dinner.ingredients:
# head broccoli , broken into florets
# pasta (we used orecchiette)
# pine nuts
# basil
# garlic clove
# parmesan , finely grated
# olive oil
# smoked pancetta , diced
# cherry tomatoes , halvedv
dinner.cooking:
# Bring a pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Add the broccoli and boil for 5 mins. Scoop out with a slotted spoon and set aside.
# Put the pasta in the same pan and cook following pack instructions. Meanwhile, tip the broccoli into a food processor with the pine nuts, basil, garlic, parmesan and oil, and blitz until smooth. Season with black pepper and a little salt (the pancetta is very salty).
#Set a frying pan over a medium heat and cook the pancetta for 2 mins. Add the tomatoes and cook for 3 mins, or until softened. Toss the pasta with the broccoli pesto, tomatoes and pancetta, and loosen with a splash of pasta water, if needed. Spoon into bowls and serve.
dinner.portions:
# 300g 
# 300g 
# 1 tbsp 
# 1 large bunch 
# 1 large 
# 2 tbsp 
# 1 tbsp 
# 50g 
# 200g

breakfast.title: Porridge with blueberry compote
breakfast.ingredients:
# porridge oats
# just under fat Greek-style yogurt
# frozen blueberries
# honey (optional)
breakfast.cooking:
# Put the oats in a non-stick pan with 400ml water and cook over the heat, stirring occasionally for about 2 minutes until thickened. Remove from the heat and add a third of the yogurt.
# Meanwhile, tip the blueberries into a pan with 1 tbsp water and the honey if using and gently poach until the blueberries have thawed and they are tender, but still holding their shape.
# Spoon the porridge into bowls, top with the remaining yogurt and spoon over the blueberries.
breakfast.portions:

lunch.title: Pigs-in-blankets Christmas stuffing balls
lunch.ingredients:
# sage & onion stuffing mix
# sausage meat
# cooked chestnuts , chopped
# dried cranberries
# rashers smoked streaky bacon or pancetta
lunch.cooking:
# Put the stuffing mix in a bowl and pour over 150ml boiling water. Leave the mix to absorb. When cool, add the sausage meat, chestnuts and cranberries and bring everything together with your hands. Cut each rasher of bacon in half lengthways so you get 24 long strips of bacon.
# Cross two bacon strips, then roll a walnut-sized ball of the stuffing mix and sit it on the cross. Wrap the stuffing in the bacon and sit on a lightly oiled baking tray, cross-side up. Repeat to make 12 stuffing balls. Can be made up to two days ahead and chilled. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and roast the stuffing balls for 25-30 mins until the bacon is crisp and the stuffing is cooked.

dinner.title: Bombay potatoes
dinner.ingredients:
# thumb-sized piece ginger, grated
# garlic cloves
# vine tomatoes, halved, deseeded and chopped
# new potatoes, halved
# sunflower oil
# onion, thinly sliced
# green chillies, halved, deseeded and thinly sliced
# black mustard seeds
# ground coriander
# turmeric
# ground cumin
# garam masala
# coriander, chopped
dinner.cooking:
# Put the ginger, garlic and four tomatoes into a food processor and blitz until smooth. Set aside.
# Put the potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water and bring to a simmer over a medium heat. Cook for 8-10 mins, or until just tender. Drain and leave to steam dry.
# Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onions and a large pinch of salt and fry for 15 mins, or until the onions are golden and sticky. Add the chillies, mustard seeds, ground coriander, turmeric, cumin and garam masala to the pan and fry for another 2 mins. Tip in the tomato mixture and bring to a gentle simmer, then carefully stir in the potatoes and remaining tomatoes. Season to taste. Gently simmer the Bombay potatoes for a few mins until everything is warmed through, then serve topped with the coriander.
dinner.portions:
# 1 
# 2 large
# 6 large 
# 800g 
# 3 tbsp 
# 1 large 
# 2 
# 1 tsp 
# 2 tsp 
# ½ 
# 1 tsp 
# 2 tsp 
# small bunch

breakfast.title: Carrot cake
breakfast.ingredients:
# carrots , peeled
# soft brown sugar
# self-raising flour
# bicarbonate of soda
# cinnamon
# zest orange
# eggs
# sunflower oil
# For the icing:
# softened butter
# icing sugar
# soft cheese
# sprinkles (optional)
breakfast.cooking:
# Line an 18cm square tin with baking parchment. Ask your grown-up helper to turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grate the carrots on the fine side of the grater, then tip them into a large bowl.
# Sift the sugar, flour, bicarb and a cinnamon on top of the carrot, then adds the orange zest and mix everything around a bit.
# Break the eggs into a bowl (scoop out any bits of shell), then add them to the bowl along with the oil. Mix everything together well.
# Scoop the cake mix into your tin and level the top. Ask a grown-up to put it in the oven for 30 minutes or until the cake is cooked. Cool.
# To make the icing, mix the butter and icing sugar together, then stir in the soft cheese until smooth.
# When the cake is cool, spread the top with the icing and cut into squares. Decorate with sprinkles, if you like.

lunch.title: Turkey tikka masala
lunch.ingredients:
# sunflower oil
# onion, finely chopped
# garlic cloves, crushed or finely grated
# thumb-sized piece of ginger, peeled and finely grated
# red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
# cumin seeds
# ground coriander
# paprika
# ground turmeric
# garam masala
# tomato purée
# passata or chopped tomatoes
# mango chutney
# double cream
# natural yogurt (optional)
# leftover roast turkey, cut into large chunks
# chopped coriander, toasted flaked almonds, steamed rice and garlic naan breads, to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a casserole dish or shallow pan over a medium heat, and fry the onions for 10-12 mins until golden. Stir in the garlic, ginger, chilli and all the spices, and cook for 2 mins more until the mixture resembles a paste. Stir in the tomato purée, passata or chopped tomatoes and mango chutney, and bring to a simmer. Cook for a further 10 mins.
# Stir in most of the cream and the yogurt, if using, and return the mixture to a simmer. Add the turkey and continue to simmer until the turkey is piping hot. Remove from the heat, drizzle over the remaining cream and stir through briefly. Scatter over some coriander and flaked almonds, and serve with the rice and naan breads on the side.

dinner.title: Middle Eastern tacos Spiced Chickpeas
dinner.ingredients:
# olive oil 
# chick peas, rinsed and drained
# sumac ( optional)
# cumin
# salt (to taste)
# sesame seeds

# Toss the salad ingredients together in a medium bowl. Lightly toast the tortillas until warm and pliable.
# Assemble. Spread hummus or baba ganoush onto the warm tortilla. Top with warm chickpeas and a heaping mound of the salad. Sprinkle with herbs and scallions.

breakfast.title: Smoky beans on toast
breakfast.ingredients:
# olive oil , plus extra for drizzling
# onion , sliced
# red pepper , thinly sliced into strips
# garlic clove , halved
# chopped tomatoes
# smoked paprika
# red wine vinegar
# butter beans or chickpeas, drained
# sugar
# seeded bread
# parsley sprigs, finely chopped
# Method
breakfast.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a small pan, add the onion and pepper, and fry gently until soft, about 10-15 mins. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 mins or until slightly reduced and thickened.
# Toast the bread, rub with the remaining garlic and drizzle with a little oil. Spoon the beans over the toast, drizzle with a little more oil and scatter over the parsley.

lunch.title: Chicken supreme
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# butter
# onion , thinly sliced
# smoked bacon lardons
# garlic clove , crushed
# skin-on chicken breasts
# plain flour
# white wine
# double cream
# Dijon mustard
# parsley , very finely chopped (optional)
# mashed potato and steamed green veg, to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Heat half the oil and butter in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the onion and a pinch of salt and fry for 10-15 mins or until golden brown and caramelized. Add the bacon, turn up the heat and cook for 5 mins or until golden brown. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min more. Scrape the mixture into a bowl and set aside.
# Heat the remaining oil and butter in the same pan over a medium-high heat. Season the chicken skin and fry, skin-side down, for 8-10 mins or until deep golden brown and crisp. Flip over and fry for 5 mins on the other side.
# Add the onion and bacon mixture back to the pan. Stir through the flour and cook for 2 mins. Pour in the wine, bring to the boil and simmer for a few minutes.
# Stir through the cream and mustard and simmer over a low heat, uncovered, for 5 mins with the chicken skin-side up. Season. Scatter with parsley, if you like, and serve with mashed potatoes and greens.

# chopped tomatoes

dinner.cooking:
# Heat grill to high. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan, and then soften 1 chopped onion and 1 finely chopped red pepper for 5 mins.
# Stir in 1 crushed garlic clove, fry for 1 min, tip in 400g chopped tomatoes and 500g gnocchi then bring to a simmer.
# Bubble for 10-15 mins, stirring occasionally, until the gnocchi is soft and the sauce has thickened.

# red onion , cut into thin wedges

breakfast.cooking:

Add the garlic, cumin, coriander and paprika and fry for 1 min more. Tip in the tomatoes, spinach and 100ml water and bubble until the spinach has wilted, then lower to a simmer and cook, uncovered, for 10 mins. Season to taste.

# chopped dried figs
# chopped dried dates
# cinnamon
# nutmeg 
# dash ground cloves 
# agave

morning_snack.cooking:
# Preheat oven to 400°F and spread the almonds in an even layer on a cookie sheet. Bake for 7 minutes, or until fragrant.

lunch.title: Lo mein noodles
lunch.ingredients:
# Lo Mein Sauce:
# soy sauce ( or GF Braggs)
# Chinese cooking wine (or mirin, or sub 1 1/2 tablespoons water mixed with 1/2 teaspoon rice vinegar and 1/2 teaspoon honey)
# oyster sauce (optional)
# sesame oil
# maple syrup, sugar or honey
# liquid smoke (optional, but tasty)
# white pepper (pinch)
# snow peas
# Lo Mein Stir Fry:
# wok oil, peanut oil or coconut oil
# onion, thinly sliced
# sliced mushrooms
# garlic cloves, rough chopped 
# ginger, minced
# red bell pepper, thinly sliced 
# matchstick carrots
# shredded cabbage
# snow peas
# Other options: a handful of baby spinach, bok choy, shredded veggies like 
Brussels sprouts, bean sprouts. In spring, asparagus is nice, in winter, roasted veggies work well too!
lunch.cooking:
# Optional Additions: Crispy Tofu ,
# Set water to boil and cook the noodles according to directions on the package.
# Stir together the Lo mein Sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
# Prep any and all veggies and set near the stove.
# In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and mushrooms and sauté 3-4 minutes, stirring continuously. Turn heat to medium; add the garlic and ginger and sauté 2 minutes. Add the bell pepper, carrots, cabbage and snow peas and stir often, just letting them get tender, but still crisp, 3-4 minutes.
# Add the noodles and give a good stir and toss a few times to incorporate.
# Add the Lo Mein Sauce and stir and toss continuously 2 minutes. If it gets too dry add a little splash of water to loosen.
# Serve in two bowls, garnish with green onion.
# If adding crispy tofu, season with salt and pepper and quickly sear in an oiled wok. Set aside on a paper towel-lined plate.  Add this into the wok with the noodles at the end with the sauce.

dinner.title: Crispy quinoa cakes with tomato chickpea relish
dinner.ingredients:
# water 
# rinsed, white quinoa (rinse and drain!!! DON’T SKIP)
# olive oil
# cumin
# granulated garlic powder
# kosher salt
# herbs de Provence  ( or Italian dried herbs) (2.5g)
# zest from one small lemon (optional) 
# chopped Italian parsley (optional)
# Fresh Tomato Chickpea Relish:
# cherry or grape tomatoes, sliced in half
# cucumber, diced
# fresh basil ( or flat-leaf parsley, dill,  or mint, or a combo!) chopped
# chopped scallions  (or finely sliced red onion)
# cooked chickpeas ( 1 can, drained and rinsed)
# olive oil
# balsamic vinegar
# salt… more to taste
# minced garlic clove (optional)
dinner.cooking:
# Read directions and watch the video before starting- this recipe can be tricky.
# In a medium pot, over high heat, add rinsed white quinoa, salt, garlic powder, cumin, dried herbs, olive oil, and stir. Bring to a boil. Cover, lower heat to low, and simmer gently for 20 minutes.  Set timer.
# While the quinoa is cooking make the Tomato Chickpea Relish, stirring all ingredients together in a medium bowl.
# Check quinoa- making sure all the water is gone. If not, continue cooking covered, 5 more minutes, and until steam holes appear (this usually takes me a total of 25 minutes) and quinoa has soaked up all the water and looks fairly dry.)  It is important that quinoa is dry-ish and not watery. Be patient here, all stoves are different. 
# While it’s still warm, stir the quinoa vigorously with a fork, for a one whole minute, until you begin to see the individual grains break apart. This is imperative, to getting the quinoa to bind. Eventually, after a full minute of stirring, the grains will break apart and begin to clump. You can visually see this. Remove from stove, let cool down in the pot to where it’s cool enough to handle with your hands, about 15 minutes.  Stir in the lemon zest and fresh parsley if you like.
# Using wet hands shape into 4 balls, the size of a tennis ball. Place on a plate or sheet pan.  Using wet hands press into a 1 – 1 1/2 inch thick cake (about 3-4 inches wide), smoothing any cracks on the edges, and making them nice and tidy. Wet hands are a key to this recipe.
# Refrigerate 15 minutes to set. As the quinoa cakes cool they will become even sturdier. (These will keep 3-4 days if made ahead, just lightly oil them, cover, and store in the fridge.)
# Gently Pan-sear the Quinoa Cakes in a well-oiled skillet (using a thin metal spatula to flip) over medium heat.  You can pan-sear them without any coating, or for an extra crispy crust, dredge in rice flour or GF Panko. I often do these without any coating at all. Just be sure to not fiddle with them- letting them develop a good crust before flipping. As then develop the crust, they will naturally release themselves from the pan. I like to use a thin metal spatula to flip (more precise).
# You can also bake these in a toaster oven (right on the rack) or in a 400F oven (on a parchment-lined pan) until warmed through, about 20 minutes, but the crust for a skillet gives these the BEST texture.
# Divide among plates and top with the fresh tomato chickpea relish.  Spoon any remaining dressing over top and around the cakes.
dinner.portions:
# 2 cups (16oz)
# 1 cup 
# 1 tsps. (5ml)
# 1 tsp  (5g)
# 1 tsp. (5g)
# 1/2 tsp (2.5g)
# 1/2 tsp.

# Preheat the waffle maker according to manufacturer’s directions and spray it with oil (unless your waffle iron is non-stick).

lunch.title: Roasted Butternut Squash
lunch.ingredients:
# butternut squash
# olive oil
# salt
# black pepper
# paprika
# Fresh parsley
lunch.cooking:
# Preheat oven to 425ºF. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
# Place butternut squash on a cutting board and using a vegetable peeler, peel your butternut squash.
# Once it’s peeled, cut your butternut squash in half and remove the seed. (more info about cutting a butternut squash, above on the post.)
# Dice your butternut squash into bite-sized pieces roughly the same size so that they bake evenly.
# Place butternut squash on the prepared baking sheet and drizzle on olive oil and season with salt, pepper and paprika.
# Toss with your hands and then place in oven.
# Roast for 15-20 minutes. Time will depend on the size of the butternut squash cubes.
# Garnish with fresh parsley.

dinner.title: Sticky chicken drumsticks & sesame rice salad
dinner.ingredients:
# chicken drumsticks
# clear honey , plus 1tsp
# tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten free)
# vegetable oil
# sesame oil
# basmati rice
# kale , chopped
# juice limes
# radishes , halved
# sesame seeds
dinner.cooking:
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the drumsticks in a roasting tin. Mix 2 tbsp honey, the tamari, 1 tbsp veg oil and 1 tbsp sesame oil in a bowl, then pour over the chicken – make sure each piece is covered. Roast for 25-30 mins.
# Meanwhile, cover the rice with 240ml water and bring to the boil. Cook for 8-10 mins until tender. Massage the kale with 1 tbsp veg oil for 5 mins until softening (this makes it less chewy). Drizzle over the lime juice, remaining sesame oil and honey, and season. Add the radishes and set aside. 
# Fry the rice in the remaining veg oil in a non-stick pan to dry out. Add to the kale, and toss to combine.
# Serve the drumsticks with the salad and scatter over the sesame seeds.

breakfast.ingredients:
# bananas , halved lengthways

# cinnamon

# walnuts , roughly chopped
breakfast.cooking:
# Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. Mash up one banana half, then mix it with the oats, cinnamon, milk, 300ml water and a pinch of salt, and pour into a baking dish. Top with the remaining banana halves and scatter over the walnuts.
# Bake for 20-25 mins until the oats are creamy and have absorbed most of the liquid.

morning_snack.title: Apple ‘doughnuts’
morning_snack.ingredients:
# soft cheese
# honey
# apples (use a crunchy eating variety)
# almond or peanut butter (optional)
# colored sprinkles , to decorate
morning_snack.cooking:
# Mix the soft cheese with the honey and set aside. Peel the apples, and then slice each through the core into five or six rings, about 1cm thick. Use an apple corer or small round biscuit cutter to stamp out a circle from the middle of each slice, removing the core and creating ‘doughnut’ shapes. Pat the slices dry using kitchen paper – they should be as dry as possible to help the toppings stick.
# Spread some nut butter over the slices, if using, then top with the sweetened soft cheese. Decorate with the sprinkles and serve.

breakfast.title: Cinnamon crêpes with nut butter, sliced banana & raspberries
breakfast.ingredients:
# gluten-free brown bread flour
# ground cinnamon
# egg
# semi-skimmed milk
# rapeseed oil , for frying
# almond nut butter (make your own with recipe in 'goes well with', right)
# banana , sliced
# raspberries
# lemon wedges
breakfast.cooking:
# Tip the flour into a large mixing bowl with the cinnamon. Add the egg and milk, and whisk vigorously until you have a smooth pouring consistency.
# Place a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and add a little of the oil. When the oil starts to heat, wipe most of it away with kitchen paper. Once the pan is hot, pour a small amount of the batter into the centre of the pan and swirl it to the sides of the pan in a thin layer. Leave to cook, untouched, for about 2 mins. When it is brown underneath, turn over and cook for 1 min more.
# Transfer to a warm plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter. Divide the warm pancakes between 2 plates and serve with the nut butter, banana, raspberries and lemon to assemble at the table.

dinner.title: Broccoli pesto & pancetta pasta
dinner.ingredients:
# head broccoli , broken into florets
# pasta (we used orecchiette)
# pine nuts
# basil
# garlic clove
# parmesan , finely grated
# olive oil
# smoked pancetta , diced
# cherry tomatoes , halvedv
dinner.cooking:
# Bring a pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Add the broccoli and boil for 5 mins. Scoop out with a slotted spoon and set aside.
# Put the pasta in the same pan and cook following pack instructions. Meanwhile, tip the broccoli into a food processor with the pine nuts, basil, garlic, parmesan and oil, and blitz until smooth. Season with black pepper and a little salt (the pancetta is very salty).
#Set a frying pan over a medium heat and cook the pancetta for 2 mins. Add the tomatoes and cook for 3 mins, or until softened. Toss the pasta with the broccoli pesto, tomatoes and pancetta, and loosen with a splash of pasta water, if needed. Spoon into bowls and serve.

evening_snack.title: Spiced fruit compote
evening_snack.ingredients:
# white sugar
# unsweetened orange juice
# dried apple, halved
# dried apricots
# dried peaches
# dried pears
# prunes
# star anise
# cinnamon stick
# flaked almonds
evening_snack.cooking:
# Combine sugar, orange juice and 1 cups cold water in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes or until sugar has dissolved.
# Add apple, apricots, peaches, pears, prunes, star anise and cinnamon stick. Stir to combine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 15 minutes or until fruit is plump and almost tender. Remove lid. Simmer for 10 minutes or until syrup has thickened slightly and fruit is soft.
# Spoon fruit and syrup into bowls. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve.

breakfast.title: Carrot cake
breakfast.ingredients:
# carrots , peeled
# soft brown sugar
# self-raising flour
# bicarbonate of soda
# cinnamon
# zest orange
# eggs
# sunflower oil
# For the icing:
# softened butter
# icing sugar
# soft cheese
# sprinkles (optional)
breakfast.cooking:
# Line an 18cm square tin with baking parchment. Ask your grown-up helper to turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grate the carrots on the fine side of the grater, then tip them into a large bowl.
# Sift the sugar, flour, bicarb and a cinnamon on top of the carrot, then adds the orange zest and mix everything around a bit.
# Break the eggs into a bowl (scoop out any bits of shell), then add them to the bowl along with the oil. Mix everything together well.
# Scoop the cake mix into your tin and level the top. Ask a grown-up to put it in the oven for 30 minutes or until the cake is cooked. Cool.
# To make the icing, mix the butter and icing sugar together, then stir in the soft cheese until smooth.
# When the cake is cool, spread the top with the icing and cut into squares. Decorate with sprinkles, if you like.

lunch.title: Meatball black bean chillis
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# beef meatballs
# onion, finely sliced
# mixed peppers, sliced
# coriander, leaves and stalks chopped
# garlic cloves, crushed
# hot smoked paprika
# ground cumin
# light brown soft sugar
# chopped tomatoes
# black beans, drained and rinsed
# cooked rice, to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish over a medium heat. Fry the meatballs for 5 mins until browned, and then transfer to a plate with a slotted spoon.
# Fry the onion and peppers with a pinch of salt for 7 mins. Add the coriander stalks, garlic, paprika and cumin and fry for 1 min more. Tip in the sugar, tomatoes and beans, and bring to a simmer. Season; return the meatballs to the pan and cook, covered, for 15 mins. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezer proof bag.
# Serve the chilli with the rice and the coriander leaves scattered over.

dinner.title: Spiced lentil & butternut squash soup
dinner.ingredients:
# olive oil
# onions, finely chopped
# garlic cloves, crushed
# hot chilli powder
# ras el hanout
# butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2cm pieces
# red lentils
# hot vegetable stock
# coriander, leaves chopped, plus extra to serve
# Dukkah (see tip) and natural yogurt, to serve
dinner.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or saucepan over a medium-high heat. Fry the onions with a pinch of salt for 7 mins, or until softened and just caramelized. Add the garlic, chilli and ras el hanout, and cook for 1 min more.
# Stir in the squash and lentils. Pour over the stock and season to taste. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the squash is soft. Blitz the soup with a stick blender until smooth, and then season to taste. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezer proof bags.
# Stir in the coriander leaves and ladle the soup into bowls. Serve topped with the dukkah, yogurt and extra coriander leaves.

breakfast.title: Oat pancakes
breakfast.ingredients:
# orange , zested and juiced
# frozen berries
# Pink Lady apple , finely diced
# porridge oats
# baking powder
# cinnamon
# oat milk
# egg , lightly beaten
# cold pressed rapeseed oil
# fat-free Greek yogurt
breakfast.cooking:
# To make the compote, put the orange juice, berries and apple in a small saucepan and gently simmer over a medium heat for 10-12 mins until the berries begin to burst and the apple has softened. Remove from the heat and leave to cool a little. Add a splash of water to loosen, if you like.
# Blitz the oats in a food processor to form a coarse flour consistency, and then tip into a mixing bowl. Add the baking powder, cinnamon and orange zest and stir well. Whisk together the oat milk and egg in a jug, then pour into the dry ingredients and combine to create a thick batter.
# Heat a little of the oil in a non-stick frying pan, then pour in 2 tbsp of the batter to make a small pancake. Cook over a medium heat for 2 mins or until small bubbles start appearing on the surface. Flip the pancake over and cook on the other side for 1 min, then transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining oil and batter (you should end up with six pancakes). Stack the pancakes on two warm plates, spoon over the compote and top with a dollop of the Greek yogurt.

morning_snack.title: Crackers
morning_snack.ingredients:
# blanched almond flour
# sea salt
# chia seeds
# egg (beaten)
morning_snack.prep:
# Preheat the oven to 350F (176C).
# Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, crack the egg in a bowl and beat it with the help of a fork or a hand mixer.
# Mix the almond flour, sea salt, and chia seeds in a bowl. Mix in the egg until a dough forms. 
#  Roll out the dough to a thin rectangular shape between two parchment papers.
# Using a sharp knife cut the cracker dough into rectangles then prick with a toothpick.
# Bake the crackers for 8-12 minutes or until golden.

lunch.title: Pork souvlaki
lunch.ingredients:
# lean pork shoulder, cut into 2cm chunks
# olive oil
# dried oregano
# lemon , zested and juiced
# hot paprika
# fat-free yogurt
# garlic clove , grated
# cucumber , trimmed and grated
# red peppers , deseeded and cut into chunks
# Little Gem lettuce , leaves separated
# chilli sauce , to serve (optional)
# flatbreads , warmed, to serve (optional)
lunch.cooking:
# Put the pork in a large bowl with the oil, oregano, lemon zest and juice and paprika as well as a good pinch of salt. Toss everything together to combine and leave to marinate for 10 mins.
# Combine the yogurt, garlic and cucumber together in a bowl. Season with salt and set aside.
# Heat the grill to high. Thread the marinated pork and the peppers on four metal skewers, alternating between the pork and peppers as you go. Place on a non-stick baking sheet and grill for 3-4 mins on each side, or until cooked through and golden brown.
# Serve with the lettuce, yogurt mixture and chilli sauce, and flatbreads, if you like.

dinner.title: Pigs-in-blankets Christmas stuffing balls
dinner.ingredients:
# sage & onion stuffing mix
# sausage meat
# cooked chestnuts , chopped
# dried cranberries
# rashers smoked streaky bacon or pancetta
dinner.cooking:
# Put the stuffing mix in a bowl and pour over 150ml boiling water. Leave the mix to absorb. When cool, add the sausage meat, chestnuts and cranberries and bring everything together with your hands. Cut each rasher of bacon in half lengthways so you get 24 long strips of bacon.
# Cross two bacon strips, then roll a walnut-sized ball of the stuffing mix and sit it on the cross. Wrap the stuffing in the bacon and sit on a lightly oiled baking tray, cross-side up. Repeat to make 12 stuffing balls. Can be made up to two days ahead and chilled. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and roast the stuffing balls for 25-30 mins until the bacon is crisp and the stuffing is cooked.

evening_snack.title: Crackers

breakfast.title: Simple Vegan French Toast
breakfast.ingredients:
# plant milk of your choice (375 ml), we used oat milk
# flaxseeds
# maple or agave syrup
# vanilla extract (optional)
# ground cinnamon
# sea salt
# bread, preferably day old (see notes)
# coconut oil (optional)
breakfast.cooking:
# Add all the ingredients to a blender (except the bread and the coconut oil) and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a baking dish or a shallow bowl and let stand for 5 minutes at room temperature.
# Place each slice of bread into the mixture, allowing the bread to soak in some of it on both sides.
# Heat some coconut oil in a griddle or a hot skillet, and place the bread slices onto the griddle/hot skillet until browned on one side, then flip and brown the other side (about 5 minutes for each side).
# Serve with your favorite toppings. We added some maple syrup, berries, chia seed jam and soy yogurt.
# Keep leftovers in a sealed container in the fridge for 3 to 4 days.
breakfast.portions:
# 1 and 1/2 cups 
# 2 tbsp
# 2 tbsp
# 1/2 tsp 
# 1/4 tsp 
# 1/8 tsp 
# 6–8 slices (1-inch-thick or 2.5 cm)

lunch.title: Stuffing baubles
lunch.ingredients:
# drizzle of vegetable oil , plus extra for greasing
# red onions
# sausage meat
# dried cranberries
# thyme , leaves picked
# fresh or dried breadcrumbs
# rashers pancetta
lunch.cooking:
# Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and grease a large baking tray. Halve the onions through the root and peel off the papery skin. Cut off any stringy roots but leave the base of the root intact. Slice a little off the rounded side of each onion half, so they will sit on the tray. Cut away the centre of the onions, reserving the off cuts, to leave a hollow – once you’ve cut away a little, you can use your fingers to pull out the layers until you’re left with a shell of 2 or 3 layers. Arrange the halves on a baking tray, season and bake for 10 mins until just softened. Set aside to cool.
# Weigh the onion off cuts and place 140g/5oz in a food processor (save any remaining onions for another recipe). Blitz until finely chopped but still with a little texture – or finely chop by hand. Heat a drizzle of oil in a frying pan and add the onions. Cook for 5 mins until softened, then set aside to cool.
# Tip the sausage meat, cranberries, thyme and breadcrumbs into a bowl. Add the fried onions and a little seasoning. Mix well. Roll the stuffing mixture into 12 balls and use to fill the onion halves. Wrap a slice of pancetta around each ‘bauble’, ensuring the ends meet underneath the onions. Can now be covered with cling film and chilled for up to 2 days or frozen for up to a month.
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Unwrap the stuffing baubles (if chilled) and bake for 25 mins until cooked through and the bacon is starting to crisp. If you’re cooking from frozen, bake for 35 mins. (If you have a full oven, it may be too steamy to crisp up the bacon, so finish with a blast under a hot grill until nicely browned and crispy.)
lunch.portions:
#
# 6 small or medium 
# 250g 
# 50g 
# small bunch 
# 50g

dinner.title: Chicken enchiladas
dinner.ingredients:
# olive oil
# red onions, sliced
# red peppers, sliced
# red chillies, 2 deseeded and chopped, 1 sliced
# coriander, stalks finely chopped, leaves roughly chopped - plus extra to serve (optional)
# garlic cloves, crushed
# ground coriander
# cumin seeds
# skinless chicken breasts, cut into small chunks
# refried beans (we used Discovery)
# sweet corn, drained
# bottle passata
# golden caster sugar
# tortillas
# pots soured cream
# cheddar, grated
dinner.cooking:
# Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in your largest pan, then fry the onions, peppers, chopped chilli and coriander stalks with half the garlic for 10 mins until soft. Stir in 2 tsp ground coriander and 2 tsp cumin seeds, and then fry for 1 min more. Meanwhile, in another frying pan, fry the chicken in the remaining oil, in batches, until browned – add it to the pan of veg as it is done.
# Stir the beans, sweet corn, coriander leaves and 150ml of the passata into the veg and chicken. In a bowl, mix the rest of the passata with the other crushed garlic clove, the remaining spices and the sugar, and then set aside.
# To assemble, lay the tortillas onto a board and divide the chicken mixture between them, folding over the ends and rolling up to seal. Divide the passata sauce into the dishes you are using, and then top with the enchiladas. Dot over the soured cream, sprinkle with grated cheese and scatter with the sliced chilli.
# Cool and freeze (see freezing tips, below) or, if eating straight away, heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6, then bake for 30 mins, scattering with more coriander leaves to serve, if you like.

breakfast.title: VANILLA WAFERS
breakfast.ingredients:
# flaxseed meal 
# water
# non dairy margarine 
# sugar
# vanilla extract
# non dairy milk
# sorghum flour
# white rice flour
# potato starch
# tapioca flour
# xanthan gum
# baking powder
# salt
breakfast.cooking:
# Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
# In a small bowl, stir together the flaxseed meal and water and let rest until gelled, for about 5 minutes.
# In a separate bowl, cream together the margarine, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth. Mix in the prepared flaxseed meal and nondairy milk.
# In a medium bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients and then combine well with the margarine mixture until a soft dough forms. Place into a large freezer bag and snip off the tip. Pipe out 1-inch circles onto the parchment-covered cookie sheet about 1 inch apart. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until golden brown on edges. Let cool completely before serving. Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

lunch.title: Sausage, kale & gnocchi one-pot
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# pork sausages
# chilli flakes
# fennel seeds (optional)
# fresh gnocchi
# chicken stock (fresh if you can get it)
# chopped kale
# parmesan, finely grated
lunch.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large high-sided frying pan over a medium heat. Squeeze the sausages straight from their skins into the pan, and then use the back of a wooden spoon to break the meat up. Sprinkle in the chilli flakes and fennel seeds, if using, then fry until the sausage meat is crisp around the edges. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon.
# Tip the gnocchi into the pan, fry for a minute or so, and then pour in the chicken stock. Once bubbling, cover the pan with a lid and cook for 3 mins, and then stir in the kale. Cook for 2 mins more or until the gnocchi is tender and the kale has wilted. Stir in the parmesan, then season with black pepper and scatter the crisp sausage meat over the top.

breakfast.title: Apple ‘doughnuts’
breakfast.ingredients:
# soft cheese
# honey
# apples (use a crunchy eating variety)
# almond or peanut butter (optional)
# colored sprinkles , to decorate
breakfast.cooking:
# Mix the soft cheese with the honey and set aside. Peel the apples, and then slice each through the core into five or six rings, about 1cm thick. Use an apple corer or small round biscuit cutter to stamp out a circle from the middle of each slice, removing the core and creating ‘doughnut’ shapes. Pat the slices dry using kitchen paper – they should be as dry as possible to help the toppings stick.
# Spread some nut butter over the slices, if using, then top with the sweetened soft cheese. Decorate with the sprinkles and serve.

morning_snack.title: Rice paper wraps
morning_snack.ingredients:
# rice vermicelli noodles
# carrot , peeled
# avocado , peeled and destoned
# cucumber
# rice paper wraps
# king prawns , peeled and cooked
# mint leaves
# cooked chicken breast, shredded
# sweet chilli sauce , to serve
morning_snack.cooking:
# Put the noodles in a pan of water and bring to the boil, simmer for 3 mins, then cool under running water. Drain thoroughly.
# Cut the carrot into matchsticks using a knife or a mandoline. Cut the avocado into strips and the cucumber into thin sticks. Soak 2 of the rice paper wraps in cold water for 1-2 mins until floppy.
# Lift 1 sheet of rice paper out of the water, shake gently, and then lay it carefully on a board. Place 2 prawns in the centre, with a mint leaf between them. Add a strip of avocado, pile some noodles on top, then add a layer of carrot and cucumber. Fold the bottom half of the rice paper over, then fold the sides in and tightly roll it up. Repeat using the second wrapper and soak 2 more to make 2 more rolls.
# Make the rest of the rolls up using the remaining 4 wraps and the shredded chicken instead of prawns. Serve the rolls with the sweet chilli sauce for dipping.

lunch.title: Pistachio lamb koftas with apricot relish
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# red onions , 2 1/2 thinly sliced, 1/2 grated
# lamb mince
# ras el hanout
# pistachios , roughly chopped
# flat-leaf parsley , roughly chopped
# good-quality apricot jam
# zest and juice lemon
# carrots , cut into skinny matchsticks
# round whole meal pitta breads , split and warmed
# Greek-style yogurt , to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Put 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil in a frying pan, add most of the sliced onions with some seasoning and cook over a medium heat for about 15 mins until soft and golden.
# Meanwhile, heat the grill to high. In a large bowl, combine the mince, grated onion, ras el hanout, most of the pistachios, half of the parsley and some seasoning. Divide the mixture into 8 and shape into patties. Place on a baking tray and brush with ½ tbsp oil. Grill for about 10 mins, turning once, until browned and cooked through. 
# Add the apricot jam, a large pinch of zest and half the lemon juice to the cooked sliced onions bubble down until thick, and then set aside. To make the salad, mix the carrots, reserved sliced onions and remaining parsley in a bowl, then toss in the remaining lemon juice and olive oil and some seasoning. To serve, spoon the apricot relish into the pittas. Then add the koftas, salad, yogurt and remaining pistachios. Alternatively, serve the pittas open with the filling piled on top.

# cucumber
# rice paper wraps
# king prawns , peeled and cooked
# mint leaves
# cooked chicken breast, shredded
# sweet chilli sauce , to serve
evening_snack.cooking:
# Put the noodles in a pan of water and bring to the boil, simmer for 3 mins, then cool under running water. Drain thoroughly.
# Cut the carrot into matchsticks using a knife or a mandoline. Cut the avocado into strips and the cucumber into thin sticks. Soak 2 of the rice paper wraps in cold water for 1-2 mins until floppy.
# Lift 1 sheet of rice paper out of the water, shake gently, and then lay it carefully on a board. Place 2 prawns in the centre, with a mint leaf between them. Add a strip of avocado, pile some noodles on top, then add a layer of carrot and cucumber. Fold the bottom half of the rice paper over, then fold the sides in and tightly roll it up. Repeat using the second wrapper and soak 2 more to make 2 more rolls.
# Make the rest of the rolls up using the remaining 4 wraps and the shredded chicken instead of prawns. Serve the rolls with the sweet chilli sauce for dipping.

breakfast.title: Mexican beans & avocado on toast
breakfast.ingredients:
# cherry tomatoes, quartered
# red or white onion, finely chopped
# lime, juiced
# xolive oil
# garlic cloves, crushed
# ground cumin
# chipotle paste or 1 tsp chilli flakes
# black beans, drained
# coriander, chopped
# slices bread
# avocado, finely sliced
breakfast.cooking:
# Mix the tomatoes, ¼ onion, lime juice and 1 tbsp oil and set aside. Fry the remaining onion in 2 tbsp oil until it starts to soften. Add the garlic, fry for 1 min, then add the cumin and chipotle and stir until fragrant. Tip in the beans and a splash of water, stir and cook gently until heated through. Stir in most of the tomato mixture and cook for 1 min, season well and add most of the coriander.
# Toast the bread and drizzle with the remaining 1 tbsp oil. Put a slice on each plate and pile some beans on top. Arrange some slices of avocado on top, then sprinkle with the remaining tomato mixture and coriander leaves to serve.

lunch.title: MUSHROOM SOUP
lunch.ingredients:
# unsalted butter plant based 
# chopped onions
# fresh mushrooms, sliced. (3 to 4 cups sliced). Cremini or white button mushrooms.
#  dry white wine, OPTIONAL
# dried dill weed or 1.5 tablespoons fresh (finely chopped) 
# hot paprika and pinch of smoked paprika (smoked paprika is optional)
# tamari sauce 
# vegetable or chicken broth
# non dairy milk
# kosher salt
# ground black pepper
# lemon juice
# chopped fresh parsley
# greek yogurt or full fat coconut milk (*canned and chilled for vegan option)
lunch.cooking:
# Heat a large pot over medium heat. Place butter* in pot and melt, coating the pan.
# Place your onions in the pot and saute for 5 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms and saute for an additional 5 minutes until mushroom are browned and coated in butter. Onions will brown as well.
# Stir in the wine, dill, paprika, tamari sauce and broth. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
# In a separate small bowl, whisk the thickening mixture; non dairy milk and arrowroot flour. Pour the flour milk mix into the soup and stir thoroughly to blend. Cover pot and simmer for 15 more minutes, stirring occasionally. 
# Finally, stir in the salt, ground black pepper, lemon juice, parsley and yogurt (or solid coconut cream). Mix together and allow to heat through over low heat, about 3 to 5 minutes. Do not boil.
# Garnish with extra chopped parsley and cracked pepper.

dinner.title: Sticky chicken drumsticks & sesame rice salad
dinner.ingredients:
# chicken drumsticks
# clear honey , plus 1tsp
# tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten free)
# vegetable oil
# sesame oil
# basmati rice
# kale , chopped
# juice limes
# radishes , halved
# sesame seeds
dinner.cooking:
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the drumsticks in a roasting tin. Mix 2 tbsp honey, the tamari, 1 tbsp veg oil and 1 tbsp sesame oil in a bowl, then pour over the chicken – make sure each piece is covered. Roast for 25-30 mins.
# Meanwhile, cover the rice with 240ml water and bring to the boil. Cook for 8-10 mins until tender. Massage the kale with 1 tbsp veg oil for 5 mins until softening (this makes it less chewy). Drizzle over the lime juice, remaining sesame oil and honey, and season. Add the radishes and set aside. 
# Fry the rice in the remaining veg oil in a non-stick pan to dry out. Add to the kale, and toss to combine.
# Serve the drumsticks with the salad and scatter over the sesame seeds.

Crush half the garlic and add this to the pan, along with the tomatoes, paprika, vinegar, beans, sugar and some seasoning. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 mins or until slightly reduced and thickened.

dinner.title: Honey & mustard chicken thighs with spring veg
dinner.ingredients:
# honey
# wholegrain mustard
# garlic cloves, crushed
# zest and juice lemon
# chicken thighs, skin on
# new potatoes, unpeeled, smaller left whole, bigger halved
# olive oil
# spinach
# frozen peas
dinner.cooking:
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a small bowl, mix together the honey, mustard, garlic and the lemon zest and juice. Pour the marinade over the chicken thighs and season.
# Put the chicken, skin-side up, on a large baking tray, and then dot the new potatoes in between them. Drizzle the oil over the potatoes and sprinkle with sea salt. Roast in the oven for 35 mins until the chicken skin caramelizes and is charred in places.
# Add the spinach and peas to the roasting tray. Return to the oven for 2-3 mins until the spinach has begun to wilt and the peas are hot and covered in the mustardy sauce.

breakfast.title: Baked banana porridge
breakfast.ingredients:
# bananas , halved lengthways
# jumbo porridge oats
# cinnamon
# milk of your choice, plus extra to serve
# walnuts , roughly chopped
breakfast.cooking:
# Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. Mash up one banana half, then mix it with the oats, cinnamon, milk, 300ml water and a pinch of salt, and pour into a baking dish. Top with the remaining banana halves and scatter over the walnuts.
# Bake for 20-25 mins until the oats are creamy and have absorbed most of the liquid.

lunch.title: Pistachio lamb koftas with apricot relish
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# red onions , 2 1/2 thinly sliced, 1/2 grated
# lamb mince
# ras el hanout
# pistachios , roughly chopped
# flat-leaf parsley , roughly chopped
# good-quality apricot jam
# zest and juice lemon
# carrots , cut into skinny matchsticks
# round whole meal pitta breads , split and warmed
# Greek-style yogurt , to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Put 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil in a frying pan, add most of the sliced onions with some seasoning and cook over a medium heat for about 15 mins until soft and golden.
# Meanwhile, heat the grill to high. In a large bowl, combine the mince, grated onion, ras el hanout, most of the pistachios, half of the parsley and some seasoning. Divide the mixture into 8 and shape into patties. Place on a baking tray and brush with ½ tbsp oil. Grill for about 10 mins, turning once, until browned and cooked through. 
# Add the apricot jam, a large pinch of zest and half the lemon juice to the cooked sliced onions bubble down until thick, and then set aside. To make the salad, mix the carrots, reserved sliced onions and remaining parsley in a bowl, then toss in the remaining lemon juice and olive oil and some seasoning. To serve, spoon the apricot relish into the pittas. Then add the koftas, salad, yogurt and remaining pistachios. Alternatively, serve the pittas open with the filling piled on top.

dinner.title: Spiced lentil & butternut squash soup
dinner.ingredients:
# olive oil
# onions, finely chopped
# garlic cloves, crushed
# hot chilli powder
# ras el hanout
# butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2cm pieces
# red lentils
# hot vegetable stock
# coriander, leaves chopped, plus extra to serve
# Dukkah (see tip) and natural yogurt, to serve
dinner.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or saucepan over a medium-high heat. Fry the onions with a pinch of salt for 7 mins, or until softened and just caramelized. Add the garlic, chilli and ras el hanout, and cook for 1 min more.
# Stir in the squash and lentils. Pour over the stock and season to taste. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the squash is soft. Blitz the soup with a stick blender until smooth, and then season to taste. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezer proof bags.
# Stir in the coriander leaves and ladle the soup into bowls. Serve topped with the dukkah, yogurt and extra coriander leaves.

breakfast.title: English Muffin and Fruits
breakfast.ingredients:
# English Muffin
# mixed berries (frozen or fresh)
# banana
breakfast.cooking:
# Rinse or defrost mixed berries, slice berries in half if too big.
# Slice banana into bite size rounds.
# Put sliced banana and mixed berries in a bowl.
# Slice English muffin in half. Toast English muffin to your preference. Plate and enjoy.

lunch.title: Beef  Bourguignon
lunch.ingredients:
# vegetable oil
# stewing or braising steak, cut into small chunks
# onions, chopped
# carrots, chopped
# celery stalks, chopped
# bay leaves
# thyme sprigs or rosemary sprigs
# plain flour
# bottle red wine
# beef stock cube
# caster sugar
# tomato purée
# unsmoked bacon lardons
# shallots or baby onions, halved or quartered
# closed cup mushrooms, halved or quartered
# mashed potatoes or crusty bread, to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Turn the slow cooker to low and heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a large frying pan. Season the meat and fry for 3-4 mins in batches until browned all over, scooping out each batch with a slotted spoon and transferring the browned meat to a plate.
# Tip the onion, carrot and celery into the pan and fry for 5-10 mins until soft. Add the herbs and flour and cook for another 2 mins. Pour a splash of the wine into a bowl, then add the stock cube, sugar and tomato purée and mix to form a paste. Scrape the paste into the onion mix and pour in the remaining wine. Bring the mixture to a bubble, then transfer to the slow cooker. Stir in the browned beef, topping up with a splash of water to cover the meat if needed. Simmer on low for 6-8 hrs until the meat is falling apart but still holding its shape.
# About 35 mins before serving, heat the remaining oil in a pan. Fry the bacon, shallots and mushrooms for 5-8 mins until caramelized and the veg is starting to soften, then tip into the slow cooker. Simmer the stew gently on high for 30 mins. If you want a thicker gravy, use the reduce function or leave the stew uncovered. Serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread, if you like.

dinner.title: Pigs-in-blankets Christmas stuffing balls
dinner.ingredients:
# sage & onion stuffing mix
# sausage meat
# cooked chestnuts , chopped
# dried cranberries
# rashers smoked streaky bacon or pancetta
dinner.cooking:
# Put the stuffing mix in a bowl and pour over 150ml boiling water. Leave the mix to absorb. When cool, add the sausage meat, chestnuts and cranberries and bring everything together with your hands. Cut each rasher of bacon in half lengthways so you get 24 long strips of bacon.
# Cross two bacon strips, then roll a walnut-sized ball of the stuffing mix and sit it on the cross. Wrap the stuffing in the bacon and sit on a lightly oiled baking tray, cross-side up. Repeat to make 12 stuffing balls. Can be made up to two days ahead and chilled. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and roast the stuffing balls for 25-30 mins until the bacon is crisp and the stuffing is cooked.

breakfast.title: Cinnamon crêpes with nut butter, sliced banana & raspberries
breakfast.ingredients:
# gluten-free brown bread flour
# ground cinnamon
# egg
# semi-skimmed milk
# rapeseed oil , for frying
# almond nut butter (make your own with recipe in 'goes well with', right)
# banana , sliced
# raspberries
# lemon wedges
breakfast.cooking:
# Tip the flour into a large mixing bowl with the cinnamon. Add the egg and milk, and whisk vigorously until you have a smooth pouring consistency.
# Place a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and add a little of the oil. When the oil starts to heat, wipe most of it away with kitchen paper. Once the pan is hot, pour a small amount of the batter into the centre of the pan and swirl it to the sides of the pan in a thin layer. Leave to cook, untouched, for about 2 mins. When it is brown underneath, turn over and cook for 1 min more.
# Transfer to a warm plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter. Divide the warm pancakes between 2 plates and serve with the nut butter, banana, raspberries and lemon to assemble at the table.

lunch.title: Bombay potatoes
lunch.ingredients:
# thumb-sized piece ginger, grated
# garlic cloves
# vine tomatoes, halved, deseeded and chopped
# new potatoes, halved
# sunflower oil
# onion, thinly sliced
# green chillies, halved, deseeded and thinly sliced
# black mustard seeds
# ground coriander
# turmeric
# ground cumin
# garam masala
# coriander, chopped
lunch.cooking:
# Put the ginger, garlic and four tomatoes into a food processor and blitz until smooth. Set aside.
# Put the potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water and bring to a simmer over a medium heat. Cook for 8-10 mins, or until just tender. Drain and leave to steam dry.
# Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onions and a large pinch of salt and fry for 15 mins, or until the onions are golden and sticky. Add the chillies, mustard seeds, ground coriander, turmeric, cumin and garam masala to the pan and fry for another 2 mins. Tip in the tomato mixture and bring to a gentle simmer, then carefully stir in the potatoes and remaining tomatoes. Season to taste. Gently simmer the Bombay potatoes for a few mins until everything is warmed through, then serve topped with the coriander.

# Put the lime zest and juice, avocado flesh, yogurt and a good pinch of salt into a blender and blitz until completely smooth. Put the sauce in a large bowl with the cabbage, carrot and spring onion and toss to combine.

# red pepper, deseeded and finely chopped
# garlic clove, crushed
# can chopped tomatoes
# pack gnocchi
# basil leaves, torn
# ball mozzarella, torn into chunks
lunch.cooking:
# Heat grill to high. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan, and then soften 1 chopped onion and 1 finely chopped red pepper for 5 mins.
# Stir in 1 crushed garlic clove, fry for 1 min, tip in 400g chopped tomatoes and 500g gnocchi then bring to a simmer.

Stir in the garlic, ginger, chilli and all the spices, and cook for 2 mins more until the mixture resembles a paste. Stir in the tomato purée, passata or chopped tomatoes and mango chutney, and bring to a simmer. Cook for a further 10 mins.

morning_snack.title: Carrot cake
morning_snack.ingredients:
# carrots , peeled
# soft brown sugar
# self-raising flour
# bicarbonate of soda
# cinnamon
# zest orange
# eggs
# sunflower oil
# For the icing:
# softened butter
# icing sugar
# soft cheese
# sprinkles (optional)
morning_snack.cooking:
# Line an 18cm square tin with baking parchment. Ask your grown-up helper to turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grate the carrots on the fine side of the grater, then tip them into a large bowl.
# Sift the sugar, flour, bicarb and a cinnamon on top of the carrot, then adds the orange zest and mix everything around a bit.
# Break the eggs into a bowl (scoop out any bits of shell), then add them to the bowl along with the oil. Mix everything together well.
# Scoop the cake mix into your tin and level the top. Ask a grown-up to put it in the oven for 30 minutes or until the cake is cooked. Cool.
# To make the icing, mix the butter and icing sugar together, then stir in the soft cheese until smooth.
# When the cake is cool, spread the top with the icing and cut into squares. Decorate with sprinkles, if you like.

# chilli flakes

# pork meatballs
# baby spinach

# Season to taste, and then add the meatballs and spinach. Simmer for 5-7 mins or until cooked through. Ladle into bowls and top with the basil and some parmesan, if you like.

afternoon_snack.title: CARROT CAKE
afternoon_snack.ingredients:
# erythritol
# softened butter
# blackstrap molasses which is optional
# vanilla extract
# pineapple extract which is optional
# large eggs
# blanched almond flour
# baking powder
# cinnamon
# sea salt to taste
# grated carrots
# chopped pecans
# Cream cheese frosting:
# softened cream cheese
# softened butter
# powdered erythritol
# vanilla extract
# heavy cream
afternoon_snack.cooking:
# For the frosting, place the cream cheese and butter into a bowl then beat with a hand mixer until combined and fluffy. Add in the erythritol and vanilla then beat properly to combine. Add in the heavy cream and beat until the mixture becomes cream, set aside. 
# Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F, place a parchment paper on two cake pans then grease then bottom of the pans with butter, set aside. Using a large mixing bowl. add in the butter and sweetener then beat to combine. Add in the molasses, vanilla, and pineapple juice then mix properly to combine. Add in the eggs, one after another then beat to combine, set aside.
# In another mixing bowl, add in the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt to taste then mix properly to combine. Pour the flour mixture into the wet mixture then mix everything to combine. Add in the grated carrots and the pecans then mix to combine. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan and bake for about thirty to thirty-five minutes until baked through. 
# Once baked, let the cake cool for a few minutes, frost with the prepared frosting, slice, and serve.

evening_snack.title: Carrot cake
evening_snack.ingredients:
# carrots , peeled
# soft brown sugar
# self-raising flour
# bicarbonate of soda
# cinnamon
# zest orange
# eggs
# sunflower oil
# For the icing:
# softened butter
# icing sugar
# soft cheese
# sprinkles (optional)
evening_snack.cooking:
# Line an 18cm square tin with baking parchment. Ask your grown-up helper to turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grate the carrots on the fine side of the grater, then tip them into a large bowl.
# Sift the sugar, flour, bicarb and a cinnamon on top of the carrot, then adds the orange zest and mix everything around a bit.
# Break the eggs into a bowl (scoop out any bits of shell), then add them to the bowl along with the oil. Mix everything together well.
# Scoop the cake mix into your tin and level the top. Ask a grown-up to put it in the oven for 30 minutes or until the cake is cooked. Cool.
# To make the icing, mix the butter and icing sugar together, then stir in the soft cheese until smooth.
# When the cake is cool, spread the top with the icing and cut into squares. Decorate with sprinkles, if you like.

breakfast.title: Healthy shakshuka
breakfast.ingredients:
# cold pressed rapeseed oil
# red onion , cut into thin wedges
# red pepper , finely sliced
# yellow pepper , finely sliced
# garlic cloves , crushed
# cumin seeds
# coriander seeds , crushed
# heaped tsp sweet smoked paprika
# can cherry tomatoes
# baby spinach
# eggs
# coriander , roughly chopped
# dill , roughly chopped
breakfast.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large, non-stick frying pan. Add the onion and peppers and fry over a medium heat for 8-10 mins until the veg is beginning to soften. Add the garlic, cumin, coriander and paprika and fry for 1 min more. Tip in the tomatoes, spinach and 100ml water and bubble until the spinach has wilted, then lower to a simmer and cook, uncovered, for 10 mins. Season to taste.
# Make four indentations in the tomato mixture and gently crack an egg into each one. Cover with a lid or foil and cook over a gentle heat for 8-10 mins, or until the eggs are just set. Uncover, scatter with the fresh herbs and serve.

morning_snack.title: BAKED SWEET POTATO
morning_snack.cooking:
# Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
# Use a fork to stab each potato 6-8 times and poke holes in it.
# Place on a baking sheet and bake for at least 1 hour or until the potatoes are soft at 400 degrees.
# Remove from the oven and after unwrapping slice them into half.
# Season with salt and pepper.

lunch.title: Turkey Bolognese pasta bake
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# onions, finely chopped
# turkey mince (thigh is best)
# garlic clove, crushed
# chopped tomatoes
# chipotle paste
# chicken stock
# pasta shells
# tub mascarpone
# cheddar, grated
# grated parmesan
lunch.cooking:
# Heat the olive oil in a large pan. Add the onions and cook for 8-10 mins until softened. Add the mince and brown all over. Once browned, add the garlic, tomatoes, chipotle paste and chicken stock, and bring to the boil. Turn down to a simmer and cook, uncovered, for 35-40 mins, adding a splash of water if it looks too dry.
# While the turkey cooks, boil the pasta following pack instructions, then drain, reserving some of the water. Warm through the mascarpone with a splash of the hot pasta water over a low heat. Add 140g cheddar, season and stir to combine.
# Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Transfer the turkey sauce to a large baking dish. Stir the cheese sauce through the pasta and pour over the mince. Sprinkle the remaining cheddar and the parmesan on top. Bake in the oven for 20 mins or until golden and crisping at the edges.

dinner.title: Chicken supreme
dinner.ingredients:
# olive oil
# butter
# onion , thinly sliced
# smoked bacon lardons
# garlic clove , crushed
# skin-on chicken breasts
# plain flour
# white wine
# double cream
# Dijon mustard
# parsley , very finely chopped (optional)
# mashed potato and steamed green veg, to serve
dinner.cooking:
# Heat half the oil and butter in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the onion and a pinch of salt and fry for 10-15 mins or until golden brown and caramelized. Add the bacon, turn up the heat and cook for 5 mins or until golden brown. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min more. Scrape the mixture into a bowl and set aside.
# Heat the remaining oil and butter in the same pan over a medium-high heat. Season the chicken skin and fry, skin-side down, for 8-10 mins or until deep golden brown and crisp. Flip over and fry for 5 mins on the other side.
# Add the onion and bacon mixture back to the pan. Stir through the flour and cook for 2 mins. Pour in the wine, bring to the boil and simmer for a few minutes.
# Stir through the cream and mustard and simmer over a low heat, uncovered, for 5 mins with the chicken skin-side up. Season. Scatter with parsley, if you like, and serve with mashed potatoes and greens.

lunch.title: Leek & butter bean soup with crispy kale & bacon
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# leeks , sliced
# thyme sprigs , leaves picked
# butter beans
# vegetable bouillon stock
# wholegrain mustard
# flat-leaf parsley
# rashers streaky bacon
# chopped kale , any tough stems removed
# hazelnuts , roughly chopped
lunch.cooking:
# Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the leeks, thyme and seasoning. Cover and cook for 15 mins until softened, adding a splash of water if the leeks start to stick. Add the butter beans with the water from the cans, the stock and mustard. Bring to the boil and simmer for 3-4 mins until hot. Blend the soup in a food processor or with a stick blender, stir through the parsley and check the seasoning.
# Put the bacon in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Cook for 3-4 mins until crispy, then set aside to cool. Add the remaining 1 tsp oil to the pan, and tip in the kale and hazelnuts. Cook for 2 mins, stirring until the kale is wilted and crisping at the edges and the hazelnuts are toasted. Cut the bacon into small pieces, then stir into the kale mixture.
# Reheat the soup, adding a splash of water if it is too thick. Serve in bowls sprinkled with the bacon & kale mixture.

breakfast.title: English Muffin and Fruits
breakfast.ingredients:

# Rinse or defrost mixed berries, slice berries in half if too big.
# Slice banana into bite size rounds.

lunch.title: Easy teriyaki chicken

# skinless and boneless chicken thighs, sliced

lunch.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a non-stick pan over a medium heat. Add the chicken and fry for 7 mins, or until golden. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for 2 mins. Stir in the honey, soy sauce, vinegar and 100ml water. Bring to the boil and cook for 2 - 5 mins over a medium heat until the chicken is sticky and coated in a thick sauce.
# Scatter over the spring onions and sesame seeds, then serve the chicken with the rice and steamed veg.

dinner.title: Rice paper wraps
dinner.ingredients:
# rice vermicelli noodles
# carrot , peeled
# avocado , peeled and destoned
# cucumber
# rice paper wraps
# king prawns , peeled and cooked
# mint leaves
# cooked chicken breast, shredded
# sweet chilli sauce , to serve
dinner.cooking:
# Put the noodles in a pan of water and bring to the boil, simmer for 3 mins, then cool under running water. Drain thoroughly.
# Cut the carrot into matchsticks using a knife or a mandoline. Cut the avocado into strips and the cucumber into thin sticks. Soak 2 of the rice paper wraps in cold water for 1-2 mins until floppy.
# Lift 1 sheet of rice paper out of the water, shake gently, and then lay it carefully on a board. Place 2 prawns in the centre, with a mint leaf between them. Add a strip of avocado, pile some noodles on top, then add a layer of carrot and cucumber. Fold the bottom half of the rice paper over, then fold the sides in and tightly roll it up. Repeat using the second wrapper and soak 2 more to make 2 more rolls.
# Make the rest of the rolls up using the remaining 4 wraps and the shredded chicken instead of prawns. Serve the rolls with the sweet chilli sauce for dipping.

breakfast.title: Oat pancakes
breakfast.ingredients:
# orange , zested and juiced
# frozen berries
# Pink Lady apple , finely diced
# porridge oats
# baking powder
# cinnamon
# oat milk
# egg , lightly beaten
# cold pressed rapeseed oil
# fat-free Greek yogurt
breakfast.cooking:
# To make the compote, put the orange juice, berries and apple in a small saucepan and gently simmer over a medium heat for 10-12 mins until the berries begin to burst and the apple has softened. Remove from the heat and leave to cool a little. Add a splash of water to loosen, if you like.
# Blitz the oats in a food processor to form a coarse flour consistency, and then tip into a mixing bowl. Add the baking powder, cinnamon and orange zest and stir well. Whisk together the oat milk and egg in a jug, then pour into the dry ingredients and combine to create a thick batter.
# Heat a little of the oil in a non-stick frying pan, then pour in 2 tbsp of the batter to make a small pancake. Cook over a medium heat for 2 mins or until small bubbles start appearing on the surface. Flip the pancake over and cook on the other side for 1 min, then transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining oil and batter (you should end up with six pancakes). Stack the pancakes on two warm plates, spoon over the compote and top with a dollop of the Greek yogurt.

lunch.title: Broccoli pesto & pancetta pasta
lunch.ingredients:
# head broccoli , broken into florets
# pasta (we used orecchiette)
# pine nuts
# basil
# garlic clove
# parmesan , finely grated
# olive oil
# smoked pancetta , diced
# cherry tomatoes , halvedv
lunch.cooking:
# Bring a pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Add the broccoli and boil for 5 mins. Scoop out with a slotted spoon and set aside.
# Put the pasta in the same pan and cook following pack instructions. Meanwhile, tip the broccoli into a food processor with the pine nuts, basil, garlic, parmesan and oil, and blitz until smooth. Season with black pepper and a little salt (the pancetta is very salty).
#Set a frying pan over a medium heat and cook the pancetta for 2 mins. Add the tomatoes and cook for 3 mins, or until softened. Toss the pasta with the broccoli pesto, tomatoes and pancetta, and loosen with a splash of pasta water, if needed. Spoon into bowls and serve.
lunch.portions:
# 300g

# 1 large bunch

dinner.title: Baked green lemon chickpeas and rice
dinner.ingredients:
# Olive oil  
# Yellow onion diced      
# Garlic cloves minced    
# White wine     
# Brown rice, rinsed     
# Dried oregano    
# Chick peas, drained and rinsed   
# Sun dried tomatoes       
# Fresh dill, chopped     
# Salt       
# Lemon, sliced and seeded     
# Vegetable stock, boiling   
# Olives, pitted            
# Baby spinach           
# Cherry tomatoes sliced in half    
# Pepper and chili flakes
dinner.cooking:
# Preheat the oven to 375 ° F.
# Heat the olive oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium heat.
# Add diced onion and cook until soft and translucent
# Add garlic and oregano cook for another minute and deglaze with white wine
# Cook until wine has reduced but things aren’t starting to stick to the pan.
# Stir in the rice, stirring to coat.
# Add chickpeas, sundried tomatoes, dill and salt. Mix well.
# Carefully pour the hot stock over the mixture and gently mix.
# Wedge the lemon slices into the mixture.
# Cover tightly with thin foil, and bake for 35-40 minutes, until the rice is cooked.
# Carefully remove the foil and stir in the spinach, olives and cherry tomatoes or serve over the top.
# Let sit for 5 minutes so the spinach wilts.

breakfast.title: Apple ‘doughnuts’
breakfast.ingredients:
# soft cheese
# honey
# apples (use a crunchy eating variety)
# almond or peanut butter (optional)
# colored sprinkles , to decorate
breakfast.cooking:
# Mix the soft cheese with the honey and set aside. Peel the apples, and then slice each through the core into five or six rings, about 1cm thick. Use an apple corer or small round biscuit cutter to stamp out a circle from the middle of each slice, removing the core and creating ‘doughnut’ shapes. Pat the slices dry using kitchen paper – they should be as dry as possible to help the toppings stick.
# Spread some nut butter over the slices, if using, then top with the sweetened soft cheese. Decorate with the sprinkles and serve.

lunch.title: Spiced lentil & butternut squash soup
lunch.ingredients:
# olive oil
# onions, finely chopped
# garlic cloves, crushed
# hot chilli powder
# ras el hanout
# butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2cm pieces
# red lentils
# hot vegetable stock
# coriander, leaves chopped, plus extra to serve
# Dukkah (see tip) and natural yogurt, to serve
lunch.cooking:
# Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or saucepan over a medium-high heat. Fry the onions with a pinch of salt for 7 mins, or until softened and just caramelized. Add the garlic, chilli and ras el hanout, and cook for 1 min more.
# Stir in the squash and lentils. Pour over the stock and season to taste. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the squash is soft. Blitz the soup with a stick blender until smooth, and then season to taste. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezer proof bags.
# Stir in the coriander leaves and ladle the soup into bowls. Serve topped with the dukkah, yogurt and extra coriander leaves.

lunch.title: Roasted Butternut Squash

# butternut squash
# olive oil
# salt
# black pepper

# Fresh parsley
lunch.cooking:
# Preheat oven to 425ºF. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
# Place butternut squash on a cutting board and using a vegetable peeler, peel your butternut squash.
# Once it’s peeled, cut your butternut squash in half and remove the seed. (more info about cutting a butternut squash, above on the post.)
# Dice your butternut squash into bite-sized pieces roughly the same size so that they bake evenly.
# Place butternut squash on the prepared baking sheet and drizzle on olive oil and season with salt, pepper and paprika.
# Toss with your hands and then place in oven.
# Roast for 15-20 minutes. Time will depend on the size of the butternut squash cubes.
# Garnish with fresh parsley.

dinner.title: MUSHROOM SOUP
dinner.ingredients:
# unsalted butter plant based 
# chopped onions
# fresh mushrooms, sliced. (3 to 4 cups sliced). Cremini or white button mushrooms.
#  dry white wine, OPTIONAL
# dried dill weed or 1.5 tablespoons fresh (finely chopped) 
# hot paprika and pinch of smoked paprika (smoked paprika is optional)
# tamari sauce 
# vegetable or chicken broth
# non dairy milk
# kosher salt
# ground black pepper
# lemon juice
# chopped fresh parsley
# greek yogurt or full fat coconut milk (*canned and chilled for vegan option)
dinner.cooking:
# Heat a large pot over medium heat. Place butter* in pot and melt, coating the pan.
# Place your onions in the pot and saute for 5 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms and saute for an additional 5 minutes until mushroom are browned and coated in butter. Onions will brown as well.
# Stir in the wine, dill, paprika, tamari sauce and broth. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
# In a separate small bowl, whisk the thickening mixture; non dairy milk and arrowroot flour. Pour the flour milk mix into the soup and stir thoroughly to blend. Cover pot and simmer for 15 more minutes, stirring occasionally. 
# Finally, stir in the salt, ground black pepper, lemon juice, parsley and yogurt (or solid coconut cream). Mix together and allow to heat through over low heat, about 3 to 5 minutes. Do not boil.
# Garnish with extra chopped parsley and cracked pepper.

# rice paper wraps

breakfast.cooking:
